channel.title: Npcs Don't Hit Back

item.title: Npcs Don't Hit Back
item.dc:creator: @Eurolite Eurolite
item.description:
@Eurolite wrote:

Alright, so I’m using Allstar V2 and my NPCS don’t hit back unless you click on them. I want them so that if you attack them, they will attack you back and hit you repetitively. I have found this in NPCHandler.Java:

if (npcs[i].npcType == 1158 || npcs[i].npcType == 2745 || npcs[i].npcType == 131 || npcs[i].npcType == 3375 || npcs[i].npcType == 1184) { npcs[i].StartKilling = person.playerId; npcs[i].RandomWalk = false; npcs[i].IsUnderAttack = true; }

But this makes it so that if you come near the npc it attacks you, or basically it makes the npc aggressive. If I remove this line:npcs[i].RandomWalk = false;, It won’t be aggressive anymore. I want it so only when you attack it it becomes aggressive and attacks you back. How do I do this?
